scenario:
The European data center construction market was valued at US$ 54.81 billion in 2022 and is expected to reach US$ 96.51 billion by 2030, registering a CAGR of 7.3% from 2022 to 2030. The market is driven by factors such as the strength of the European economy, the rise in demand for cloud computing, and the increased reliance on digital technologies. The market encompasses various infrastructure types and offerings, including electrical infrastructure, mechanical infrastructure, general infrastructure, solutions, and professional services.

The construction of Tier 4 data centers, which provide the highest level of uptime and fault tolerance, is expected to present a promising opportunity for the Europe data center construction market growth during the forecast period. Companies such as EBRC, CTRLS Datacenters Ltd., and Sunbird Inc. are involved in the construction of Tier 4 data centers.

The market is segmented based on types of construction, tier standards, industry verticals, and country. The electrical design segment held the largest share in 2022, followed by the tier 3 segment. The IT & telecommunication segment held the largest share in 2022, followed by the BFSI segment.

Key companies operating in the European data center construction market include Rittal, Schneider Electric, DPR Construction, Mercury Engineering Ltd, STO Building Group, AECOM, Turner Construction Co, and Eaton Corp. The market is expected to experience growth due to the increasing implementation of hyperscalers and colocation, the growing construction of Tier 4 data centers, and the increasing adoption of green data centers.

The forecast period for the report is 2022-2030, and the estimated market value in 2022 is US$ 54.81 billion. The forecasted market value by 2030 is US$ 96.51 billion, with a compound annual growth rate of 7.3%. The regions covered by the report include Europe.
